section.title: SystemBuilder Builds Appliances
section.para: An appliance is a set of software applications within an operating system (OS) that forms a single distribution unit. Using SystemBuilder, an open source appliance builder, you can create, deploy and maintain a custom appliance:

listitem.para: combine it with one or more applications,
set OS and application configuration parameters,
deploy it to clients using standard tools and methods,
change the appliance components and configuration,
update existing clients using standard package update tools such as YUM.

textobject.para: SystemBuilder takes various inputs (OS, applications, configuration files, etc.), combines that with an appliance definition file (.appliance) and creates an appliance distribution with deployment images and an appliance package repository. Using the bootable media, you can deploy the appliance to one or more client systems. You can also update the appliance repository and clients.

section.para: In summary, SystemBuilder is a robust appliance life cycle manager for use in defining, building and maintaining appliances that are easily deployed and updated using industry standard tools.
